summary: This is an email exchange between an FBI Assistant Special Agent in Charge and the Chief of the Public Corruption Unit at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding the Epstein case. The SDNY informs the FBI they have notified the Deputy Attorney General's office about their investigative steps and plan to contact victim attorneys.

persons.name: Assistant Special Agent in Charge
persons.role: FBI Assistant Special Agent in Charge
persons.context: FBI official in the New York Field Office receiving an update about the Epstein investigation from the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Chief Public Corruption Unit
persons.role: Chief of the Public Corruption Unit, U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: SDNY official informing the FBI that they have notified the Deputy Attorney General's office about their investigative steps regarding Epstein and plan to contact victim attorneys.

connections.description: The SDNY Chief is updating the FBI ASAC about investigative steps and coordination with the DAG's office regarding the Epstein case.

events.title: SDNY updates FBI on Epstein investigation coordination
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York informs the FBI that they have notified the Deputy Attorney General's office about their investigative steps and intention to contact victim attorneys in the Epstein case.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza (U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York)
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein as of December 2018.
The SDNY had informed the Deputy Attorney General's office about their investigative steps regarding Epstein.
The SDNY planned to reach out to attorneys representing Epstein's victims.
The Deputy Attorney General's office had not raised any issues with the SDNY's planned investigative steps at that time.
This email shows coordination between the FBI and SDNY regarding the Epstein investigation.
